models.manifesto: The closing statement displayed below the triptych - the philosophical anchor of the section.
models.pillars: Each pillar represents a core identity principle displayed as a floating glass monolith. Contains the headline, icon type, and description revealed on click.

relationships: Pillars are displayed in order (01, 02, 03) as the three monoliths
The manifesto stands alone as the section's closing tagline

manifesto.tagline: We do not sacrifice usability for aesthetics. We use aesthetics to enforce usability.

pillars.label: THE RIGOR
pillars.headline: SYSTEMS ARCHITECTURE
pillars.description: Beauty without structure is decoration. My foundation is built on cryptographic security (Node/HMAC), scalable infrastructure, and type-safe reliability. I don't just write code; I engineer distinct, crash-proof ecosystems.

pillars.label: THE SOUL
pillars.headline: TACTILE ETHEREALISM
pillars.description: Software should feel physical. I reject static pixels in favor of 'Living Interfaces' - environments that breathe, react to touch, and use motion physics to guide the user's intuition. We turn 'users' into 'operators'.

pillars.label: THE OUTCOME
pillars.headline: HIGH-VELOCITY IMPACT
pillars.description: The 'Reactionary Gap' kills conversion. I bridge the divide between complex data and human perception. The result is not just a pretty website, but a high-performance conversion engine that commands authority.
